metadata.Title: CVE-2011-5092 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Best Practical Solutions RT 3.8.x before 3.8.12 and 4.x before 4.0.6 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code and gain privileges via unspecified vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2011-4458 and CVE-2011-5093.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-5092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.0.6-2
rt4-apache2 - 4.0.6-2
rt4-clients - 4.0.6-2
rt4-db-mysql - 4.0.6-2
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.0.6-2
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.0.6-2
rt4-fcgi - 4.0.6-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-2').
